item.title: Access Southern Oscillation Index Data with rsoi package in R
item.description: Introduction The Southern Oscillation Index (SOI) is defined as the standardized difference between barometric pressure between Tahiti and Darwin, Australia. The SOI is one measure of the large-scale fluctuations in air pressure occurring between the western and eastern tropical Pacific (i.e., the state of the Southern Oscillation) during El Niño and La Niña episodes. In general, smoothed time series of the SOI correspond very well with changes in ocean temperatures across the eastern tropical Pacific.
